reviewText: It's a port of a mobile game with a few bells and whistles added. I like Zero Punctuation as well as the next person, but the fan factor isn't enough to carry the game. It doesn't work as a game in itself or as the clever anti-game it wants to be. It's slow, it's repetitive, and nothing really feels rewarding. It's a time sink and that's about it.

reviewText:
Simple as gameplay. You move your character left and right with the arrow keys, stand in a shadow and catch the hat (or fridge) on your head. Eventually you'll find minigames in between levels that change the game up a bit, stockpile hats that you can use to spend on 'skins' for characters and acquire gifts like a swear jar that throws obscenities at your face everytime you catch a hat.

Like I said, simple as. Its got some replayability.

7/10 its aight.

reviewText: A bit of a one-note joke that's worth your money on sale once the bugs have been ironed out. I am writing this review the day I bought the game (shortly after its release), and the game has crashed three times in 10 minutes of play, and I have a pretty good PC too that is far past the recommended specs (I'm a bit surprised this is such a sloppy port, considering Yahtzee's high standards, and yes, I know he himself was not involved with the game's development). There may be patches to come, and then the game will probably be somewhat fun, I may consider buying this again, and even making this review positive. However, until this game is fixed, I cannot recommend with a clear conscience and will be refunding the game. Also, $5 seems a bit high for a mobile port, don't a think?\n\nTL;DR Overpriced, kind of fun game that shouldn't be bought until it is both patched and on sale (or better yet, had it's price permanently lowered).
voteText: 52 of 77 people (68%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
This game is a simple action game, where your goal is to move your character and catch the hat on your head. The control system is simple, you control your character with the arrow key to the left or to the right. After a catch, the next level makes it a bit harder to catch the hat; for example more random things fall from the sky, and you don’t know what is the hat, if you don't pay attention you can catch a fridge. Between levels level you can play sometimes mini games, this especially can make the game funny. After you reached some milestones you can get a “gifts” for your character. The hats what you collect you can use for skins. The graphic style simple as simple as the game is. The sound and music is good.

So my verdict

+mini games
+good sounds and music
+steam achievements and trading cards

-if you play long time in a row can be tiresome
-a bit high price

So this game does not want be more than what it is. It can be a good time killer if you want play something in your free minutes when you just want to turn your mind off.  Price for this game I think a bit high, but if it got a bigger discount or it's get included in a bundle you maybe can give a chance to it.

7/10

reviewText:
Just...where do I begin with this game?
First of all, this game has graphics so superior that I'm surprised my rig could even handle it.
And then the story?
GAH!
I thought I loved BioShock's story, but...wow. Just...wow. I was not expecting such a marvelous story from this game.
The part where Jake Starbone realizes the true whereabouts of Princess Hamflute - WOW! - never before have I seen such characterization in a video game character. It was like he was truly a human being standing in front of me!
Wow. Just...wow.
Though, I must admit this rather shyly, I do still think my favorite part was when that local ponce - oh, what a charming fellow, lost his hat.
.
.
.
Oh, and the time I got squashed by a flying car and jumped backward a good half foot.

reviewText:
This game is... Well, you catch a falling hat. That's it.
If you familiar with Ben 'Yahtzee' Croshaw, you will pretty much think this game is cool.
I do think it's cool, the mechanic is simple and addicting
but the technical stuff itself isn't that great.
If you are not Yahtzee's fan, I suggest that you should play the free version first (pretty much the same)
http://www.addictinggames.com/action-games/hatfall-game.jsp (please don't use adblock)

buying this game is just like supporting the devs and Yahtzee directly.

Good-
It's addicting, simple, wacky, memey, funny and you can play as Yahtzee (it's my lifelong dream)

Bad-
The game locks at 30FPS, might cause a slight control delay.
Low resolution screen and texts.
Not that much sound and the texts get repetitive pretty quick.

I will give this game a 7.5/10 as a fan but my real score is around 6.5-7 / 10

reviewText:
Even if you're not from The Escapist, you probably heard of Zero Punctuation anyhow.

Yahtzee decided to make a simple game based off his series, and let me tell you- it's pretty fun. Do keep in mind the gameplay is quite repetitive mainly because it's the same thing every round ... you're trying to get under the falling hat. That's the objective, to catch the hat onto your head. However there are other elements to make it more amusing / challenging, such as clones of said character to distract you or other objects falling down at times (causing instant death).

Then you have the Wizard which changes things up. Eventually, after so many rounds you get a gift to purchase cosmetics for your 'office'. Eventually you will unlock minigames that are the highlight of the game itself. I honestly feel if you're a fan of Yahtzee by any means, you'll get a kick out of this game. If you're not, then you'll find it to be a chore after 20 minutes if not less.

But for $4 dollars, it's a pretty good game. I enjoyed it, and the references scattered about (only fans will pick them up). But do be warned, if you play after an hour and something happens, you'll be confused as what to do next. Try the wheels mini game, then you'll understand what i'm talking about.

This game is literally actually unexpectedly good.

reviewText: Hatfall is a great game. Combining both challenging and fun gameplay, Hatfall is sure to leave you on your toes.\n\nTo explain on this a bit, let's talk about the gameplay. You play as Yahtzee (famous from Zero Punctuation) who has lost his hat. Whilst this may not sound like something interesting, believe me it's quite fun. It combines a mechanic found often in mobile games, namely short and quick reaction gameplay. Your task is to get Yahtzee his nice looking hat back. Every 25 hats you get to choose between gifts" indicated by the progress bar on the sections below the level. Said gifts
recommended: frequently permit a minigame to be unlocked: e.g. Unlocking Hatsassin's Creed causes you to be dropped of in a clear parody of a dating sim.\n\nThe game itself doesn't prefer to play nice on you. Instead it favors to downright insult the player. In-between level sections and a second before the level begins
hoursPlayed: you get a pop-up message. These message always involve doing something with a hat. If you succeed
voteText: you are greeted with another popup message
helpfulPercent: which always involves boosting Yahtzee's massive ego or make more fun about hats. But those things are insulting to the player who doesn't know what Zero Punctuation is: A webshow about reviewing Video Games on their negative points. Of course the game was going to be insulting.\n\nAlthough I don't know what the 1500 hat collective does yet
votesHelpful: it will probably involve Yahtzee laughing at me for wasting my time on this great addictive game."

reviewText: Honestly I thought it was a joke at first that Yahtzee was making a game, but here it is and for only a few bucks its a pretty amusing game. the game is fast-paced, odd, and weirdly satisfying. The objective is to position your Zero Punctuation Avatar under a falling hat. Do it right and you move on, miss and well game over. Each level lasts about three seconds and rewards quick reflexes, which is especially true as many levels start placing your avatar among several others in an attempt to trick you, or two shadows; one a hat and the other death. When you collect a certain amount of hats you are given an award that may appear on Yahtzee's desk in between levels or may actually shake things up and for the sake of spoilers I will not detail the shake ups as they have to be seen to believe.\n\nAll in all, its an amusing, funny, and well put together game thats easily worth the four bucks I paid for it, its especially worth it if you are a Zero Punctuation fan.

reviewText:
This game is not what it appears.

If you want comparisons, it would be frog fractions 2 with conventional video game references.

You start off as an average able-bodied white-male protagonist, trying to catch ambiguous falling objects through the shrinking of shadows casted over the ground. Every level, an NPC would be added to interfere with you controlling your avatar. By stealing your cisgendered character's identity through a form of digital theft, or some sort of broken keylogging, they can mimic your avatars moves to interfere with your attempt to catch this mysterious object.

After about two dozens of these objects I've collected, giggles were unleashed like the first step out of a library after smoking a bowl in the bathroom.

I played this game to see what total biscuit can make, not laugh up a hernia.

reviewText:
I bought this game as a fan of yathzee and the zero punctuation series.
I had already played the free online version to 100% and watched all the ZP videos at least 5 times each.

My plan when getting this game was to play for about half an hour and then leave to write an school essay.

Next thing I knew 2 hours had passed, I played through all the minigames twice, went to ms. P.O.A Horse and mr. P.O.A Horse wedding, got myself a golden desk, got my golden desk stolen, acquired the technology to make the world's most infamous gun, raepd a manga hat and I'm still nearing the middle of the game.

In summarily, HatFall is a beautiful looking, beautifully written, beautifully atmospheric timesink. And if a timesink is all you want, then Christmas has come early. On a flying hat that swears.

reviewText:
Attended a horse engagement party. 10/hat

On a slightly more serious note, it's a simple little game about catching hats (and avoiding deadly items) by frantically running around and parking yourself under shadows of falling things, with some other weird/awesome side activities.

It's not a masterpiece, obviously, but it's fun and it's funny. If you enjoy Yahtzee's videos and you'd like to throw him enough change for a cup of coffee, but you're too cheap/lazy to become a Patreon patron, go buy this game.

reviewText:
Hatfall is a game based on Zero Punctuation, a series about a very cynical man criticizing games with the use of analogies. This game is fun. It is a rare mobile port that's good. It's all about catching hats.

PROS:
-Silly
-Good Artstyle
-Fun to Play
-Decent Controls (WASD to move, that's it)
-References to the source material
-PRAISE RANDO

CONS:
-Not many references, would've liked to see more than 1.
-A little bit irritating

Overall, it's a great game. 9/10.
